column5: Ya got it from him. I only have mallard no wood duck . Just winged it, on this one.LOL He uses the 85/15 wool/nylon for his as well .
Yeah he's awsome if u can understand him! Here's one i tied using his technique! I use brown partridge for the legs!
Decided to tie up some of those WD 40 for dropper under a dry. #18 caddis curved
They look great
Next week I give the weighted sows a go with the fly rod. Float boat is all ready to go .
Got the leaders today Gil.  Thanks a bunch . Can not wait to give,rÂ Â  .  Brian
Hey! About time ! Giver!! Lemme know! And if ur goin through Orangeville! Dont forget! Cheers!

LOL I knew the title would make ya have a gaze. LOL  After making mama caddis,s , out popped the baby's . Dang they sure are small and cute looking. Just like their papa,s.  LOL Mama will be the bottom hook,kiddies on a drop above . Now to spend the next hour uncrossing me eye,s .
The babies would drive crappy wild !!!
Wow, I wish I could do stuff like that, I am struggling to tie bucktails. Beautiful workðŸ¤—
You could put 3-4 of them on yer pinkie finger nail Norm. Tiny.

How tiny you ask ? Well,one hook went flying out of the vise clamp. Not sure what happen there, but it made a tinkle noise on the floor right behind me on the hardwood. Turn to look and well,could not see it. Wife looks and I say, you aint going to see it. Why not, is what I get. I show her a tied fly. Yup,I aint going to see that hook. LOL So sweep the floor and well, still didn't find. Or maybe we both just did not see it.LOL
Looking good

Oh man, I know what you mean.Â I saw it leave, I heard it hit the floor and now it's gone. Reminds me of my days rebuilding carburetors. A check ball spring decides to take off before you get it pinned; just forget about it; it's gone never to be seen again. LOL Dan.
You got me, totally Lovely work.
Now ya talkin'! Fished those relentlessly on my brown river in the UK..
What size hook is the mamas ? We use a 1/32 oz. size Finess jig for crappy or 1/16 oz size...
I think I'd need a microscope to tread the 2# test thru eyeletðŸ™‚

Brian, your a better man than me.I dont tie anything smaller than a 16.Hands are too clumsy and eyes dont work so good any more! Some recent ties,from left.olive scud,greenrockworm,quill abdomen wet fly,nd a WD 40!Â  Hey,have u tried a furled leader? They are awsome! Built myself a jig and been making some! Hers one with indicator butt section.U gotta try them!
a magnet is your friend.Â  Or of course you can use your bare foot, it will find a hook without fail. Doug
Really like this tie. Great for a fresh water shrimp IMO .

Scuds are a killer fly! If they are natural in the water ur fishing! Abit of work to tie in smaller sizes!Â  Sawyers Killer bugs areÂ  better ! If i knew someone from Orangeville,i could get the special wool needed to tie them! Anyone from Orangeville on here?

I use the furled leaders regularly; love them.Â  Little tip from experience; do not use in extreme shoulder seasons.Â  The furled leader builds ice like dipping a candle wick; then when reeling in and not watching it broke the tip of my rod!
Very nice Brian!

I have been looking for 85%/15% wool nylon . When Micheals allows pubic access,I will be looking for it . I have just used a some what thread to make some pupa,s . What store in Orangeville ? I could stop in when I visit the Grand . I pass through there .

Camilla Valley Farms on Blind Line! One rd. west of hwy.10. They have the special yarn for killer bugs! Its Jamieson's Spindrift color is # 290 OYSTER!Â  If u go and buy one ball ill split it with you! Enough for a lifetime! Lemme know.
https://www.ebay.ca/p/598687773
115 yds.$8.25 can. At Cammilla Valley .
Found it. Thanks
Nice tie ! Check out Davie MacPhail on utube! He ties an awsome pupa!
